verses.roman:
vidhehi te kiṅkarīṇām
anuṣṭheyaṁ tavājñayā
yac-chraddhayānutiṣṭhan vai
mucyate sarvato bhayāt

synonyms: vidhehi—please order; te—Your; kiṅkarīṇām—by the maidservants; anuṣṭheyam—what should be done; tava—Your; ājñayā—by the command; yat—which; śraddhayā—with faith; anutiṣṭhan—executing; vai—certainly; mucyate—one will become freed; sarvataḥ—from all; bhayāt—fear.
translation: Now please tell us, Your maidservants, what we should do. Certainly anyone who faithfully executes Your order is automatically freed from all fear.

purport.content: The surrender of Kāliya's wives was now complete, and Lord Kṛṣṇa immediately gave them His mercy, as described in the following verses.
